content: Edit Minutes/Photo = total edit minutes ÷ final photo count; target ≤ 2.3.
context: Track per shoot; trigger ShotClock if trending high.

content: New deliverable starts ShotClock. T-12h → amber + Slack; T-2h → red + auto ‘Rush Edit’ task.
context: Protect SLAs on stacked weekends.

content: Confirm call time, shooting window, access points, releases, house rules, strobe/haze policy, set list, comp shots.
context: Avoid delays with security/FOH.

content: All retainers on Stripe subscriptions (auto-pay). One-offs Net-7 with 25% booking retainer.
context: Stabilize cash flow; reduce AR days.

content: Photographer retains copyright. Client gets non-exclusive social/venue promo license. No third-party ads without upgrade.
context: Prevent ad/mass campaign reuse without fee.

content: Strict: no depiction of minors with alcohol; purge on notice.
context: Nightlife compliance and platform safety.

content: Model, Venue, Group releases required; store signed PDFs in client folder.
context: Any identifiable subjects; crowd scenes if featured.

content: Primary CTA above the fold; one core action per screen; cut form fields to essentials.
context: One-pager micro-site for retainer sales.

content: 1) Exterior sign 2) Walk-in POV 3) DJ/dance 4) Funny group interview 5) Hype slow-mo 6) Exit transition.
context: Every venue; lock 1–3 within first 25 minutes.

content: Import → preset → Remini upscale → NanoBanana prompt-fix → crop → export → gallery → email.
context: Target ≤2.3 edit min/photo.

content: Canonized tiers: Pilot $345 (invite-only), Tier 1 $445, Tier 2 $695, VIP $995.
context: Public pricing page & Stripe products.

content: Daily cadence: 5 tailored DMs, 1 demo/night, target 1 retainer/week.
context: Rabbit Hole + two new venues on rotation.

content: Brand pillars: Energy, Consistency, Measurable Results.
context: Use pillars in copy, proposals, and post captions.

content: Founder persona = Johnny Cage (legal: Joshua Whaley), nightlife creator/expert; public-facing brand.
context: Use 'Johnny Cage' in reels lower-thirds and bio name field.

content: Associated brands: GettUpp ENT (B2B subscription), GettUpp Girls (merch vertical).
context: Cross-promote GettUpp Girls in reels endcards and Link-in-bio.

content: Voice = direct, energetic, ROI‑oriented, nightlife‑savvy.
context: Message venue owners with outcome-first language (deliveries, time, ROI).

content: Palette: Gold #D9AE43, Pink #FF3C93, Ink #0B0B0D; high-contrast/nightlife aesthetic.
context: Use for site, reels frames, pricing cards, and watermarks.

content: Headings: Poppins/Montserrat; Body/UI: Inter/Roboto.
context: Use Poppins Bold for headers, Inter Regular for body across decks.

content: Primary geography: Minneapolis, MN; neighborhoods: North Loop, Warehouse District, Downtown, Uptown.
context: Prioritize outreach lists and route batching around these clusters.

content: Ideal venue: IG 5k–25k followers, weekly programming, strong brand identity.
context: Score leads; de-prioritize under-1k follower venues unless strategic.

content: Local market gap: no public monthly retainer offering for nightlife photo + reels; existing options are inefficient.
context: Use gap in pitch decks; contrast with freelancer cost/consistency.

content: T1 $445/mo: 1 shoot, 30 edited photos, 72h delivery (~$67/hr).
context: Starter for venues that want weekly presence without video.

content: T2 $695/mo: 2 shoots, 60 photos + 2 reels, 48h delivery (~$60/hr route‑batched).
context: Pitch to venues with Fri/Sat programs; emphasize batching.

content: T3 $995/mo: 3 shoots, 80 photos + 3 reels, 24–48h delivery (~$50/hr).
context: For top venues; include monthly check-in.

content: Pilot $345 one-time: 1 shoot, 30 photos, 72h delivery; limited to 3/month.
context: Use scarcity to close fast; require autopay setup.

content: T3 underpriced at larger scope; Option A (rec): keep $995 and scope=3 shoots/80 photos/3 reels; Option B: reprice to ~$1,212.
context: Apply Option A immediately in pricing cards.

content: Add‑ons: 60s video $199–249; extra batched shoot $275; extra reel $149–249; rush +$50–100.
context: Offer during negotiation or monthly peaks.

content: IG DM keyword 'PILOT' → quick reply → intake form → SOW → Stripe autopay.
context: Automate with Tally + Zapier; store contact and stage in CRM.

content: “We already have a photographer.” → “We’re a content engine with 24–72h delivery every time.”
context: Paste as Quick Reply in IG.

content: “Pricing is high.” → ROI: $695 for 60–80 posts = $9–12/post vs freelancers; cost of inconsistency.
context: Use in deck cost comparison slide.

content: “No budget.” → Start at $445; many upgrade in 2–3 months.
context: Offer Starter and set review checkpoint.

content: Profiles: @JohnnyCage (name: Nightlife Photo + Reels, CTA DM 'PILOT'); @GettUppENT (name: GettUpp Nightlife Content Subscriptions, value prop).
context: Pin offer/proof/testimonial content on both.

content: Posting cadence (CST): Mon 6p Tips; Wed 7p Portfolio; Fri 8p BTS; Sat 9p Coverage; Sun 6p Reel.
context: Load in content calendar; use Scheduled Posts.

content: Use data‑backed testimonials (e.g., “32% lift in profile visits in 30d”) and headline metric 79.7K views (90d).
context: Turn quotes into reels lower-third and carousel slides.

content: UTM structure: source/medium/campaign/content; example URL in report.
context: Add UTM builder preset to Link-in-bio.

content: Tracking stack: GA4 + Facebook Pixel.
context: Install on site/landing pages; verify events.

content: Core principle: 'Time is the business.' Design every SOP for speed and margin protection.
context: Use when deciding between gear/process choices.

content: Cluster shoots geographically; priming 2–6p; nightlife 7–10p windows.
context: North Loop cluster example route.

content: Remini: process in batches of 15; Enhance=Standard; Face Enhance=ON; Texture Protect=Medium.
context: Batch uploads to hit ≤2.3 min/photo KPI.

content: NanoBanana presets: Global Corrective + Face Fix; finalize color/style consistency.
context: Apply after Remini export.

content: Targets: Edit ≤ 2.3 min/photo; Admin ≤ 75 min/client; T2/T3 batched ≥ 50%.
context: Monitor weekly in KPI dashboard.

content: MN LLC steps: name, Articles ($135 online), EIN, Sales Tax ID, bank, Operating Agreement, Minneapolis business license, insurance.
context: Track completion in legal checklist.

content: Nontaxable Advertising safe harbor: Stripe Tax OFF; remove tax cell; use 'creative promotional services' phrasing; include exemption footer statement on SOW/invoices.
context: Keep template language consistent across docs.

content: Client policies: Autopay; Net‑7; 3% late fee; 1 global revision (minor edits only); promo/web/social license (no resale/sublicense); cancellations <48h=50%, <24h=75%; one rollover (60‑day expiry).
context: Embed in MSA + SOW.

content: 2% ACH discount is net-profitable vs credit cards (ACH 0.8% capped $5 vs CC 2.9% + $0.30).
context: Offer ACH on onboarding; show savings table.

content: Accounting stack progression: Sheets → Wave → QuickBooks Self‑Employed.
context: Migrate when revenue complexity increases.

content: KPIs: Revenue/hr $53 (T3 benchmark), AR ≤10d, Renewal ≥60%, Proof Pack completion 100%.
context: Track weekly in kpi_dashboard.xlsx.

content: Choose Cal.com (unlimited event types on free) + Tally (unlimited forms with logic).
context: Avoid paid tools until scale needed.

content: Zapier: Trigger=New Tally response → Action=Create CRM contact (Sheets/CRM).
context: Use to keep Admin ≤ 75 min/client.

content: Year 2: add St. Paul & Bloomington; explore white‑label and franchise later.
context: Reassess after Minneapolis base is 6–8 active retainers.

content: Day 1–30: 2 pilots + +33% IG link clicks (9→12+). Day 31–60: 4–5 subs; ≥50% T2/T3 route‑batched. Day 61–90: 6–8 subs; ~24 hrs/week workload.
context: Review every 2 weeks; update dashboard.

content: AR Days = average days from invoice to paid; target ≤ 10.
context: Stripe + Sheets blend.

content: Retention = months client remains on subscription; target ≥ 6.
context: Report monthly churn/retention.

content: Hook (0–2s) → Beat-synced cuts (3–20s) → One micro-interview (≤5s) → Logo/CTA endcard.
context: Venue highlight reels.

content: Stages = Prospecting → Qualified → Proposal Sent → Negotiation → Closed-Won/Lost.
context: Kanban pipeline in Sheets → future ConnectSphere.

content: Set COA: Income (retainers/one-offs/add-ons/performance), COGS (freelancers/software), Opex, Assets, Liabilities, Equity.
context: QuickBooks or Wave; monthly recon.

content: Protect effective minimum of $60/hr across stacked nights.
context: Decline/adjust gigs below floor after transit & edit time.

content: Test: 40 RAW + 1 reel; match reference look; avg ≤2.3 min/photo; deliver in 24–48h.
context: Select top 2 for bench.

content: Inside 72h → 50%; inside 24h → 100% of booking retainer (or first month).
context: Protects against last-minute drops.

content: Galleries hosted 90 days; archive retrieval $49 thereafter.
context: Sets storage expectations; recovers handling cost.

content: Overtime billed at $85/hr; after 1:00 a.m., $125/hr.
context: Late-running headline DJ sets.

content: One round of minor edits per batch: photos (global adjustments), reels (text/timing). Extras: $15/photo, $50/reel.
context: Controls scope creep while staying flexible.

content: Always tag outbound links with UTM (source, medium, campaign, content). Log in a UTM registry sheet.
context: Venue case study posts + ads → track per venue and per night.

content: Maintain 3 copies, 2 media types, 1 off-site; nightly checksum + weekly archive.
context: Nightlife shoots with high churn.

content: Mini-gallery next morning; full album per SLA; monthly PDF report with reach/tags/top performers/time-to-publish.
context: Tier 1 (48h), Tier 2/VIP (24h).

content: $35 per qualified table inquiry (phone + party size + date). $0 setup; cap 20 leads/night.
context: Layer onto content nights; track separately.

content: I don’t sell ‘content.’ I deliver tracked RSVPs & table leads. Give me one night; if it doesn’t move numbers, don’t keep me.
context: Use for first contact with GM/owner.

content: Within 24h of the venue’s peak post: send results snapshot + 3-slide deck + retainer offer (Tier 1 or 2).
context: Ride the algorithmic peak for maximum willingness to buy.

content: Brand asset: Johnny Cage — MF Poster Type (Johnny Cage · poster_type). Local path: /mnt/data/gettupp_brand_assets_2025Q4/johnny_cage_poster_type_04.png
context: Use on reels endcards, profile/headers, posters, and merch. Respect safe margins and palette.

context: Use on reels endcards, profile/headers, posters, and merch. Respect safe margins and palette.

content: Thu–Sat after 9pm shows highest engagement; schedule reels 6–9pm.
context: Optimize Legacy Drops and venue tags.

content: Two-line energy + venue tag; call to action (‘DM for your pic’); branded hashtags at end.
context: Standardize high-performing captions.

content: Client supplies cleared audio for reels or accepts platform library usage; no unlicensed tracks.
context: Avoid muting/takedowns on IG/TikTok/FB.

content: 1.5%/month late fee after day 10; automated dunning on day 2/5/9.
context: Keeps payments timely without manual chase.

content: $100–$150/night + 10 edited selects; deliver RAW same night; follow file hygiene SOP.
context: Use for large nights or dual-venue routes.

content: Provide public takedown contact; acknowledge within 24h; remove within 72h pending review.
context: Mitigates privacy or safety complaints.

content: Publish a ‘Legacy Drop’ reel every Fri/Sat/Sun 6–9pm CST.
context: Anchor weekly brand narrative around weekend energy.

content: Naming: YYYYMMDD_Venue_Shoot##_[PHO|VID]_v#; no spaces; underscores only.
context: Keeps export/delivery consistent across freelancers.

content: Two-venue stacking boosts effective $/hr if transit <20 min and first venue hits must-haves early.
context: Dog House → Rabbit Hole Friday stack.

content: Long-form (60–75s) $199–$249; same-night rush +$125; extra reel $75; creator collab post $50.
context: Upsell on high-energy nights.

content: Two-step: (1) Acknowledge & outline fix (2) Deliver fix + follow-up check-in. Avoid public back-and-forth.
context: Use when client posts negative feedback.

content: 24h after delivery → review ask SMS/DM with direct link; screenshot wins and file under venue.
context: Compounds social proof for closes.

content: Use Cal.com for bookings; enforce buffers between stacked venues; auto reminders at T-24h/T-2h.
context: Reduces no-shows and lateness.

content: Mission Statement is not filled in this draft; add final line.
context: Draft one-liner for public site hero and proposals.

content: Founder Vision field not yet filled; add founder note for About page.
context: Collect 2–3 sentences about long-term vision.

content: “Need high-energy photos/reels this weekend? I shoot, edit fast, and deliver by next day. DM to lock your night.”
context: FB Marketplace / IG story ad.

content: Primary: Black/Gold; Neon accents: Magenta/Cyan; moody/reflective look.
context: Keep grid coherent; apply to title cards.

content: ‘DM for your pic’ CTA increases inbound by 20–40% on average nights.
context: Post carousels with CTA in first caption line.

content: Minneapolis nightlife photographer; club photographer; DJ photos; event photographer MN; affordable photographer MN.
context: Facebook Marketplace & site SEO.

content: Requested credit: “@johnnyc.nightlife / GettUpp ENT” where feasible.
context: Bios, posters, reels endcard.

content: {"colors": {"gold": "#D9AE43", "pink": "#FF3C93", "ink": "#0B0B0D"}, "fonts": {"heading": "Poppins|Montserrat", "body": "Inter|Roboto"}}
context: Canonical palette and font stack for all assets.

content: {"model": "Subscription Model B \u2014 Unified", "tiers": [{"code": "T1", "name": "Friday Nights", "price": 445, "shoots": 1, "photos": 30, "reels": 0, "sla_hours": 72}, {"code": "T2", "name": "Weekend Warrior", "price": 695, "shoots": 2, "photos": 60, "reels": 2, "sla_hours": 48}, {"code": "T3", "name": "VIP Partner", "price": 995, "shoots": 3, "photos": 80, "reels": 3, "sla_hours": 24}], "pilot": {"price": 345, "shoots": 1, "photos": 30, "reels": 0, "sla_hours": 72, "limit_per_month": 3}, "addons": [{"name": "Long 60s video", "price_range": "199-249"}, {"name": "Extra batched shoot (same night)", "price": 275}, {"name": "Extra short reel", "price_range": "149-249"}, {"name": "Rush delivery", "surcharge": "+50-100"}]}
context: Supersedes prior tier variants. Treat as single source of truth.

content: {"payments": "Autopay required; Net-7; 3% late fee", "revisions": "1 global pass (minor edits only)", "usage_rights": "Promo/web/social license; no resale/sublicense", "cancellations": "<48h=50% fee; <24h=75% fee; 1 rollover max with 60-day expiry", "mn_tax": "Use 'creative promotional services' language and exemption footer; Stripe Tax OFF"}
context: Insert verbatim in SOW/MSA and invoicing templates.

content: Mission: Deliver predictable, AI‑enhanced nightlife content that drives venue revenue through speed, consistency, and measurable results.
context: Use verbatim on site hero and proposals.

content: Vision: Build the Midwest’s leading nightlife content network—then productize the playbook into a Business‑in‑a‑Box for creators nationwide.
context: Place in About page and investor one‑pager.

content: Nightlife Capture Set (6 clips): 1) Exterior sign hit, 2) Walk‑in POV, 3) DJ/dance floor hit, 4) Funny group interview, 5) Hype slow‑mo movement, 6) Exit transition POV.
context: Run this loop once per venue hour; guarantees coverage parity.

content: Template fields: name, IG handle, follower band, price band (per‑night / retainer), deliverables, turnaround, style notes, proof link, moats, weaknesses.
context: Use to compile top 3–5 MSP nightlife competitors.

content: B2C Photo Rescue & Enhancement: $10 single; $25 3‑pack; $60 / 10 images. Turnaround 24–72h. Accepted: JPG/HEIC; Deliver: JPG 1080×1920 or original aspect; 1 minor revision.
context: Sell via Gumroad/Stripe link; target attendees/tables; upsell to venue retainers.

content: Per‑lead guardrails: unique phone validation; duplicates within 30 days not billed; weekly cap configurable (20/40); refund on invalid phone; venue receives CSV + opt‑in language.
context: Attach guardrails in SOW addendum and nightly report.

content: UTM rules: campaign=YYYYMM_theme or venue_code_week; content=postType_seq (reel01, car02); medium=social_paid|social_organic; source=instagram|facebook|tiktok; use lowercase, hyphens.
context: Example: ?utm_source=instagram&utm_medium=social_organic&utm_campaign=202511_launch&utm_content=reel01

content: MN keyword bank: event photographer; wedding photographer; Minneapolis photography; St Paul photos; portraits near me; club photographer; nightlife event photos; DJ photography; affordable photographer MN; birthday photographer.
context: Use in Marketplace titles, site H1/H2, IG name field, and captions.

content: Headline proof: 79.7K views in last 90 days (rollup metric).
context: Show on site hero and pitch deck; update monthly.

content: Case snippet: “32% lift in profile visits in 30 days” for pilot venue.
context: Use with date range and screenshot ref in carousel.

content: KPI Sheet columns: date, clients_active, shoots_done, photos_delivered, reels_delivered, hours_total, revenue_total, revenue_per_hour, ar_days, renewal_rate, proof_pack_done_pct.
context: Formulas: RPH=revenue_total/hours_total; renewal_rate=renewals/clients_up_for_renewal; proof_pack_done_pct=delivered/committed.

content: GA4 events: lead_submit(source,venue,utm_campaign), dm_click(profile), booking_request(venue,tier), file_download(asset), view_pricing(tier). FB Pixel: Lead, ViewContent, CompleteRegistration.
context: Implement on landing pages + Link-in-bio; map UTM joins.

content: 3‑2‑1 Backup: 3 copies (work drive, external, cloud); 2 media types; 1 off‑site. Folder tree: /Client/Venue/YYYY‑MM‑DD_Event/{RAW,SELECTS,EXPORT_SOCIAL,EXPORT_PRINT}. Naming: VENUE_YYYYMMDD_seq.ext
context: Run after each shoot; verify checksum before card format.

content: Templates: North Loop (7:30p Inbound, 8:30p RH, 9:30p Vanquish); Uptown loop (7:15p Williams, 8:15p Cowboy Jacks, 9:30p Drink). Buffers: 15 min transit/ingress.
context: Use Friday/Saturday routing; refine with live conditions.

content: Delivery considered met when gallery link + reel files sent; image count ±5% ok; color cast <5% variance; faces sharp in hero shots; rework triggers: missed hero, >10% soft focus, delivery late beyond SLA window.
context: QA checklist before delivery; log defects in sheet.

content: ShotClock: fields {shoot_id, due_at, status_color, hours_left}. Thresholds: amber at T‑12h, red at T‑2h. Actions: amber→notify; red→create 'Rush Edit' task + DM draft to client if delay expected.
context: Display counter badge in CRM list view; updates hourly.

content: Invoice/SOW footer: “Services rendered as creative promotional services; not subject to MN sales tax per Minnesota Department of Revenue guidance on nontaxable advertising (video production for advertising).”
context: Keep Stripe Tax OFF; use service wording in all docs.

content: Retention: RAWs 90 days; selects 180 days; final exports 12 months. Takedown: public web form; verify requester identity; remove within 7 days unless contractual exception.
context: Post takedown link on site footer; track in log.

content: Overtime: +$75/hr past agreed window (15‑min increments); weather delays billed; travel overruns beyond 30 mins billed at $50/hr.
context: Add to SOW under 'Scheduling & Overtime'.

content: Insurance targets: General Liability $1–2M; Equipment replacement value; Professional Liability (E&O) $1M; COI available within 2 business days; claim contact recorded.
context: Keep COI PDF in /Legal/Insurance/COI_current.pdf.

content: COA: Revenue {Retainers, Pilots, Add‑ons, Per‑lead}; COGS {Second shooters, Editors, Gear rental}; OpEx {Software, Subscriptions, Marketing, Travel, Meals, Insurance, Phone, Cloud Storage}; Assets {Cameras, Lenses, Laptop}.
context: Load into Wave/QB; tag transactions monthly.

content: Budget cols: month, clients_t1,t2,t3,pilot, revenue, cogs, gross_margin, op_ex, net_income, cash_end. Default: target 6–8 retainers by month 3; ad spend $300/mo.
context: Use as planning sheet; update monthly actuals.

content: Recognition: pilots at delivery; retainers ratably monthly upon service period; prepaids deferred; cancellations recognize kept portion per policy.
context: Align bookkeeping entries with SOW dates.

content: Roles: Shooter, Editor, Brand Rep. Steps: DM outreach→ test task → 1 paid night trial → NDA/IP → onboarding. Scorecard: reliability, low‑light skill, turnaround.
context: Use per‑role scorecards; store trials in HR folder.

content: Tools: Homebase for shifts; Gusto for payroll/contractor 1099; pay cadence weekly (Fri); contractor invoices Net‑7 with W‑9 on file.
context: Implement once first contractor is onboarded.

content: Training packs: Nightlife Shotlist, Editing Pipeline, File Standards, Client Comms, Safety & Consent, Incident Log SOP.
context: Assign via shared drive links; require sign‑off.

content: Alt‑text: subject, action, lighting/mood, venue; 120 chars target. Subtitles: SRT burned + captions on; ensure 42‑char line max, 2 lines, 1–6s duration.
context: Apply to reels and site galleries; improves reach.

content: Spanish snippets: DM opener “¿Quieres contenido semanal para tu venue? Entra con ‘PILOT’.” Invoice note “Servicios creativos promocionales; entrega 24–72h.”
context: Use for bilingual venues and attendees.

content: Editing-Only: client provides up to 30 RAW/JPEGs; deliver 30 edited photos in 72h; global look matched to GettUpp baseline; includes 1 minor revision round.
context: Use for venues/creators who shot in-house but need the GettUpp look.

content: Pricing: $199 for 30 photos (72h). Add-ons: +$75 same-night rush; +$15/photo advanced retouch; +$25/photo object removal; +$49 archive retrieval.
context: Anchor price on efficiency KPI (≤2.3 min/photo).

content: Client upload → verify rights checkbox → import → preset → Remini (Std/Face ON/Texture Med) → NanoBanana (Global+Face) → export → gallery link → email with before/after pair.
context: Mirror normal pipeline; omit capture steps.

content: “Shot in-house? I can give it the GettUpp look in 72h. Send up to 30 images; I’ll handle skin, color, and club-lighting cleanup. If it doesn’t lift your feed’s quality, don’t keep me.”
context: IG DMs and email outreach; pair with portfolio carousel.

content: KPIs: Edit Minutes/Photo ≤ 2.3; Editing-Only TAT ≤ 72h; Revision rate ≤ 15%; CSAT ≥ 4.6/5.
context: Log in KPI dashboard; trigger ShotClock on T-12h and T-2h.

content: Client confirms they own/hold rights or have permission to submit images for editing; non-exclusive promo license back to GettUpp for portfolio use unless opted out.
context: Checkbox + line in SOW; avoids copyright disputes.

content: Add a ‘Editing-Only’ block: 3 before/after pairs, 3-bullet benefits (color/skin/club-lighting), 72h SLA badge, $199 CTA, and FAQ about rights & rush.
context: Below primary CTA on one-pager; one action per screen.

content: On Stripe payment → create ‘Editing-Only’ job → set TAT=72h → T-12h Slack amber → T-2h red + auto ‘Rush Edit’ task.
context: Same cadence as capture jobs; different template.

content: Create Stripe Product ‘Editing-Only (30) – 72h’ with Price $199; add Rush as $75 one-time add-on; enable ACH and display 2% ACH discount.
context: Stabilize cash flow; reduce AR days to ≤10.

content: “Your shots, our finish. ✨ Send 30 & get the GettUpp look in 72h. DM ‘EDIT’ to start.” #NightlifeGold #EnergyPink #Minneapolis
context: Pin to @GettUppENT and @JohnnyCage; set DM keyword = EDIT.

content: GettUpp Girls is the nightlife apparel vertical of GettUpp ENT—a micro-brand built around bold, fitted women's tops (crop tees, tie-back crops, long-sleeve crops) designed as an 'unofficial uniform' for hosts, dancers, bottle girls, bartenders, and nightlife-heavy friend groups.
context: Use when explaining what GettUpp Girls is in decks, bios, and brand one-pagers.

content: Current core slogan set for GettUpp Girls apparel: 'GETT UPP GIRLS', 'Too Hot To Get Down', 'Upp All Night', 'Life of the Party', 'Own The Night', 'We Only Get Down For Each Other'.
context: Use these as the base text set for new designs, prompts, and product mockups; keep typography bold and easy to read in dark club environments.

content: GettUpp Girls visual system: base garments in black or white; hero palette is Gold (#D9AE43) and Hot Pink (#FF3C93) with optional neon accents. Typography is large, condensed or blocky sans-serif for the main slogan, with script or smaller caps for secondary lines. Repeating visual motifs: arrow icon, lips mark, and subtle sparkles/glow for 'bottle girl / club girl' energy.
context: Use for any new merch design, AI prompt, or layout; keep palette and motifs consistent with the GettUpp ENT brand but more overtly feminine/nightlife.

content: Initial GettUpp Girls product range: (1) Fitted crop tee, (2) Tie-back crop tee, (3) Long-sleeve crop, (4) Standard fitted tee, (5) Limited run specialty tops for 90s/2000s nights and theme parties. All pieces are designed as 'going-out tops' that pair with mini skirts, jeans, or shorts for club use.
context: Defines the v1 product catalog for POD setup, mockups, and Shopify/landing-page SKUs.

content: GettUpp Girls v1 fulfillment uses print-on-demand via a provider like Printify, with high-quality blanks such as Bella+Canvas or AS Colour women’s crop tees. Standard flow: design in Figma/GenSpark → upload print file to POD → create mockups → sync to storefront (Shopify/landing page) → auto-route paid orders to POD for printing and direct shipment to customer.
context: High-level description of the POD tech stack and workflow; refine with exact providers and SKUs before scale.

content: Each GettUpp Girls top should eventually include a discrete QR/Barcode patch (e.g., hem tag or lower-back print) linked to a smart URL that routes to: (1) the GettUpp ENT photo gallery ('Find your photo from last night'), (2) the GettUpp Girls shop page, and/or (3) an opt-in page for SMS/IG follow. QR must be small enough not to break the aesthetic.
context: Defines how merch connects back into the content engine and list-building system.

content: Initial pricing strategy for GettUpp Girls nightlife tops: target retail range $32–$42 per top, aiming for ≥55% gross margin over all-in POD cost (blank + print + platform fees, excl. shipping). Use higher price points ($40–$45) for long-sleeve/tie-back or limited collab designs worn by key nightlife staff or influencers.
context: Baseline pricing guardrails; update once actual POD quotes and real conversion data are available.

content: Core acquisition channels for GettUpp Girls: (1) Instagram and TikTok reels featuring nightlife photo/video content, (2) in-venue visibility via shirts worn by bottle girls, bartenders, DJs’ girlfriends, and regulars, (3) barcoded shirts linking to galleries and shop, and (4) occasional pop-up racks or collab drops at specific clubs/events.
context: High-level channel mix to reference when planning campaigns, launches, or experiments.

content: Position GettUpp Girls as: 'The unofficial uniform for the girls who never wait in line.' Not generic streetwear, but nightlife-first pieces tied to specific scenes, DJs, and venues. Differentiate from Shein/Fashion Nova by being hyper-local to nightlife culture, backed by real event photography, and limited-run drops connected to actual parties.
context: Use in decks, copy, and sales pitches when explaining why GettUpp Girls is different from generic fast fashion.

content: GettUpp Girls content loop: (1) Sell shirts primarily to nightlife-active women; (2) Encourage mirror selfies, GRWM clips, and in-club photos while wearing the tops; (3) Capture professional photos at venues via GettUpp ENT; (4) Post carousels and reels tagging wearers and venues; (5) Re-share UGC and drive back to the shop + email/SMS list; (6) Use the best photos as ads and landing-page hero shots.
context: Defines how merch, content, and lead gen connect; use when designing campaigns or automation flows.
